Posts.Content: Scmommato3 wrote: I've had problems (burning pain and tenderness) in my left breast. MRI report says "enhancement of the nipple and subareolar region" (left breast). What does this mean? I was given bi-rads 2, benign findings. My doctor doesn't wish to investigate further Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI question? Scmommato3 Pandabear123

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2016 11:54AM Scmommato3 wrote: I've seen so many doctors. ðŸ˜ž He is the closest thing we have to a breast surgeon here in the middle of nowhere. He's a general surgeon "specializing in breast conditions." I have swollen lymph nodes all over my body so he is going to biopsy one. Although he doesn't think it has to do with my breast. I am so lost and confused
Posts.Title: MRI question? Scmommato3 Pandabear123

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2016 04:44PM Scmommato3 wrote: Hi Pandabear! Hope you're doing well with your situation. From my understanding, enhancement means it 'lit up' with the contrast during the MRI. I read that the nipples can sometimes light up but only one nipple lit up so that's why I'm confused. I would feel better if they both did or if they both didn't...plus it's in the painful boob! I guess it's no big deal or it wouldn't be classified as benign lol. If only I went to school to be a radiologist instead of a grade school teacher...the irony is that I spent my first semester of college in an x-ray tech program (I realize that's not the same thing).
Posts.Title: MRI question? Scmommato3 Pandabear123

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2017 08:30PM Scmommato3 wrote: Thanks for the responses. I posted a new topic because I was hoping the title would draw the attention of someone who had experience with cysts. I truly don't mean to offend or annoy, I'm just in a lot of pain with my stupid boob and wanted to hear if anyone else is like me (having fibrocysticproblems with one and not the other). Ravzari, I am so glad to hear that you had much denser tissue and more pain in one breast than the other (not that I am glad you were in pain). It's just that my right breast doesn't hurt and is not lumpy at all. This pain hit me from out of the blue so I have been so worried. Breast cancer runs rampid through my family. No one I talk to seems to understand how painful this is! I can barely wear my bra or lay flat on my stomach and I'm not large chested. I'm just glad to hear that this is 'normal.' Thanks for your reply. Hopefully my mind can rest now.
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2017 05:24PM Scmommato3 wrote: RNstrong and Ravzari, thank you so much for the very detailed responses. Male doctors should not even be allowed to say that breast pain is normal! *insert eye roll* One even told me I'll just have to "grow out of it." A prophylactic mastectomy might be worth considering in the future if the problems persist. I'm not sure what my husband would think, but at this point he is exhausted from me complaining about it so he would probably welcome it. I very much appreciate the support and useful information. Thank you so much.
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Scmommato3 wrote: Dear wonderful readers and responders, You all are amazing. Seriously. I have been posting on here for months and I hope that I don't offend anyone by posting here again. I have a long list of things going wrong in my body, but it all started after I started having pain in one breast. I don't know if it is related to my breast or something different entirely. I woke up suddenly in May with pains in my left breast. It felt almost as if it had been injured because it was so sore. Since then I have had stabbing and burning pains all in the same breast. I have since found out that I have four cysts in that breast and none in the other. I know that it is more tender just before my cycle but I do still have the stabbing pains throughout the month. The breast is noticably larger than the other, more so before my cycle, but remains larger all month. I am concerned about IBC as the breast is so much larger than the other, but no actual lumps have been found aside from cysts and increased areas of fibrosis. I've seen 3 breast specialists who have dismissed these concerns, and I want to believe them- truly! I'm just wondering if this sounds normal of fibrocystic breasts. For one breast to be affected and not the other, and also to have more pain before a cycle, but still have considerable amounts of stabbing pain throughout the month. The nipple also looks different than the other. When I take my bra of it looks 'spread out' but the other does not. I know that you can't diagnose me, I guess I'm just hoping someone will say, "Yes, I have one cyclical lumpy breast and not the other that also gives me stabbing pains throughout the month totally apart from my cycle!" I have had innumerable health concerns pop up in the last few months and it is destroying my life. I'm just hoping it is not connected to my weird boob. I hope that no one finds me annoying or disrespectful for posting another question. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2017 09:49PM Scmommato3 wrote: RNstrong, thanks so much for the positive advice. I guess I'm having a hard time because I haven't had any biopsies and I know that is the only sure way to know. It sounds so crazy to not trust 3 doctors it's just that two of them laughed at me and said I am too young for breast cancer. None were willing to biopsy or even drain my (large) cysts. As a teacher it would be unprofessional for me to laugh at my students' concerns. I don't know why my doctors have been so comfortable with belittling me. :(
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2017 09:47AM Scmommato3 wrote: Ravzari, lol on the woody breasts! My nickname through school was woody but not because of my breasts. My maiden name is Arrowood. ;) Na Na, my lymph nodes there are palpable, but on the ultrasound they appeared perfectly normal. I actually had lymph nodes pop up all over my body so the general surgeon I was seeing wanted to rule out lymphoma by doing a biopsy of one. He took one from my opposite armpit because it was bigger (still only 1.2 cm). He told us he got the largest one from there. Results were benign "sinus histiocytosis." Doing a google search of "sinus histiocytosis" I found that this is a common finding adjacent to cancer (ugh!) or due to infection. He told me it is a perfectly normal finding but I still don't know what to think of it. I wish he had taken a node from the armpit of the breast I was having problems with but he was thinking lymphoma not breast cancer so he wanted the biggest node he could feel.
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2017 07:32PM Scmommato3 wrote: Hi and thank you for the response. I have quit drinking caffeine and started juicing every day and I can tell a huge difference. I can barely feel the cysts now but the breast is still noticeably bigger than the other and I'm still having a lot of pain and keep finding more lymph nodes. :( I don't know what to think. I hope my doctor is able to help me.
Posts.Title: Anyone with cysts and lymph nodes? Scmommato3 Scmommato3

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2017 11:55AM Scmommato3 wrote: I know this is an old thread I just want to say how happy I am to see that I am not the only person with shoulder/back pain from fibrocystic breasts. I have a large amount of fibrous tissue and fourcysts in just my left breast (right one is only slightly lumpy) and I have all kinds of pain with it! Shooting and dull achy pain as well as back/shoulder/arm pain. Not that I am happy other women have this problem, I'm just glad it is normalish.

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2017 09:35AM Scmommato3 wrote: hah! I just realized that comment about kefir was on this thread! lol it really does help. I've been reading a lot (probably too much) on here. It's all running together
Posts.Title: Anyone get back and chest pain with fibrocystic? Jesus_girl CancerSurvivors

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2017 06:38PM Scmommato3 wrote: RNstrong thank you for your support. I am amazed at what a difference it has made to quit the Pepsi and juice regularly. I used to have a huge area of thickening that my doctor called fibrous tissue. It was really big like the size of a golf ball or bigger. but not round. It has almost completely disappeared. I just don't understand where these lymph nodes are coming from if there's nothing in the breast. I don't feel anything in there anymore where I used to feel the cysts and fibrous tissue, just the lymph nodes. :
Posts.Title: Anyone with cysts and lymph nodes? Scmommato3 Scmommato3

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2017 01:59PM Scmommato3 wrote: just thought I would update that I've seen my doctor and she ordered a whole slew of bloodwork. They took 11 capsules of blood and did an ultrasound of the lymph nodes she felt in my groin. I'm very impatiently waiting for my results. She thinks I may have lupus or another autoimmune disorder and that my breast problems are disconnected from what other problems I'm having. I hope she is right
Posts.Title: Anyone with cysts and lymph nodes? Scmommato3 Scmommato3

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2017 09:56PM Scmommato3 wrote: I stopped drinking caffeine when this all started. I've read up on fibrocystic breast and that's why I was concerned that only one is affected. Everything I read says both usually are affected. Hearing from other women that have issues with one more than the other has eased my mind. I thought that's what the "worried but not diagnosed" forum was about.
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2017 09:43AM Scmommato3 wrote: Ravzari, Thanks again for your wonderful advice. It's so great to hear from someone who has already been through this! I am mostly worried that if I do end up with a cancerous lump, I won't be able to recognize it because my breasts are so lumpy! I already know that they are extremely dense. They are so dense that they could not even find 4 good sized (1 cm or larger) cysts in my mammo and one of the ultra sounds. So even if I do routine screening every 6 months as advised, I will have to argue for at least an ultra sound but preferably breast MRI (which is very expensive). Sigh, I am beginning to think that they will have to go! I don't think that my husband will really be against it. He knows that this is causing me pain, but you are right. It is up to me in the end! I would say at 25 I am probably pretty young to be thinking about a preventative mastectomy, but I am in a lot of pain and I do have breast cancer in my family. I will definitely consider this if not for now then a couple of years down the road. If there is anything nasty hiding in there that is probably going to be the only way they will find it! Thanks again for your advice. You are so very appreciated.
Posts.Title: Cyclical and Non-Cyclical Breast Pain in One Breast? Scmommato3 pomita

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2017 09:29AM Scmommato3 wrote: Pumpkin 88 I know exactly how you feel. Until last May I never thought about my breasts. That is when I started getting cysts. I have four large ones in my left breast and a tiny one in the right. They are so painful all month long. I read a comment somewhere on this site from a lady that had fibrocystic breasts and she said she takes a probiotic and drinks kefir every day. I started taking vitamins and a probiotics and drinking a cup of kefir each day and I've noticed a big difference. My breasts are less swollen. I'm so thankful for this board. Benign breast conditions are very stressful for young women who have never experienced breast issues before.
Posts.Title: Anyone get back and chest pain with fibrocystic? Jesus_girl CancerSurvivors

Posts.Content: Scmommato3 wrote: Long story short, my left breast has bothered me for months. I've had an MRI which only showed several cysts and enhancement of the left nipple. My doctor told me don't come back you're good. So I have spent the last few weeks ignoring the breast. Well, I woke up with some soreness and touched the area beside the breast down from my underarm and there are several palpable lymph nodes and one huge puffy one the size of a quarter or larger. I did not realize they were there because I've been trying to ignore the pain and swelling in the breast because my doctors have made me feel like I am crazy. Now I'm worried again. Has anyone had lymph nodes pop up with cysts? I don't want even know what to do because every time I go to the doctor they act like I'm crazy. :( Log in to post a reply
